group_1.textLeft: Was it Rabi and her friends that you were talking@about, who experienced a living hell?

group_1.textRight: Yes, Mistress Nayuta. You have the right of it.
But, the only thing we can do@is accept that living hell.
Here in this city, they killed@students, staff...everyone...

group_1.textLeft: Are you saying that she was telling the truth...?
That you all were killing students here...

group_1.textRight: Even though it wasn't our intention,@as a result of our actions, they were killed.
All because we were trying to tell the world@about the existence of Magical Girls.
Yes, we haven't decided on it conclusively,@but that is what we believe for now.

group_1.textLeft: You believe that telling the world about@Magical Girls will only lead to despair.
Papa told me the same thing before we came here...
Just what in the world happened to all of you...?

group_1.textRight: Why do you want to reveal the existence of@Magical Girls to the world, Mistress Nayuta?

group_1.textLeft: For the sake of saving Magical Girls.

group_1.textRight: In what way would they be saved?

group_1.narration: "Many of us Magical Girls are driven to@make our wishes by the influences of our family,@our environment, and the society around us."

"So, if the existence of Magical Girls is known@to society at large, then the people around us@can help stop contracts before they are made,@and though it may be difficult, we may be able to@establish social rules that prevent contracts."
"...However, rather than enforcement of rules,@I hope that girls will be saved by@people becoming kinder."

"I believe that a significant percentage of girls@form contracts with Kyubey in order to change@the unfortunate circumstances and environments@around them that have been created by the words@and actions of others."
"I know that I'm mostly just repeating@what Papa has said, but..."
"When I learned that Magical Girls become Witches,@I felt a terrible and indescribable emptiness.@I thought that it was because nobody is able see us,@to know what Magical Girls are."
"I think, therefore I am.@Even if one can conclude their own existence@to oneself, one's existence to society can@only be confirmed by being recognized by others."
"Therefore, to try to bring peace to myself,@I wanted to make the existence of@Magical Girls known to others."
"Yet it all it ended up bringing about@was inescapable misfortune for Magical Girls."

group_1.textRight: It went well at first, and spreading the truth of@our existence seemed to be a good thing...
However, misfortune began@to fall upon those close to us...
First, one of my classmates, whom I was@supposed to protect, was killed by a Witch.
I had another classmate there as well.@I had sworn to defend them both,
but in letting one die, I incurred the other's wrath.

group_1.textLeft: There was also the accident,@and many people died there...
In addition, there had been an avalanche@over the winter the caused many deaths,
and we ended up receiving@the blame for that as well.

group_1.textRight: And on top of all that, word got out@that Magical Girls turn into Witches,
so all of the problems and disasters started@getting blamed on Magical Girls.

group_1.textLeft: So then, the fury of those people that captured me...

group_1.textRight: It's really not all that misplaced...
